text: A Fantastical Meal () is a 1900 French short silent trick film directed by Georges Méliès. It was released by Méliès's Star Film Company and is numbered 311 in its catalogues. == Plot == A man and two ladies sit down to have dinner, but several unexpected surprises prevent them from their repast: the legs of the table get larger, the table goes into the floor, and a ghostly spirit pops up and takes possession of the man.imdb A Fantastical Meal (1900) The film was imitated by Edwin S. Porter for the Edison Manufacturing Company film An Animated Luncheon. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1900 films Category:French films Category:French silent short films Category:French fantasy films Category:1900s fantasy films Category:Films directed by Georges Méliès Category:French black-and-white films
title: A Fantastical Meal
